definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
to provoke (esp. annoyance, disgust etc)/to offend/to attract (attention)
to stir up the fire/fig. to provoke and offend people/to ruffle feathers
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
Yogyakarta, city of Java, Indonesia, and capital of the Special Region of Yogyakarta 日惹特區|日惹特区[Ri4 ye3 Te4 qu1]
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
can't afford to offend/dare not provoke/difficult to deal with/insufferable
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats

sentences.english: It is research that is guaranteed to delight men - and infuriate the women in their lives.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究结果一定会让男人高兴，惹女人生气。

sentences.english: Envy assails the hoblest, the winds howl around the highest peak……
sentences.chinese: 位高遭人妒，峰高惹风吹。

sentences.english: I always made you angry, do not be persuaded, of course, has now admitted the mistake was.
sentences.chinese: 我总是惹你生气，还不听劝，当然现在已经知错了。

sentences.english: You will be extremely sentimental, and if pushed by others you may hold a lasting grudge.
sentences.chinese: 你会非常敏感，如果别人惹了你，你可能会记仇。

sentences.english: All because of something as tiny as a mosquito.
Spring is just wonderful world, Jalan poem several times before the wedding day.
sentences.chinese: 妙是人间春正好，佳期几度惹诗才。

sentences.english: He is very quick-tempered, so no-one dares to offend him.
sentences.chinese: 他的脾气很火爆，一般人不敢惹他。

sentences.english: The March wind is fretful, fretting the languid wave into murmurs .
sentences.chinese: 三月的风躁动不安，惹得倦怠的波浪哗哗作响。

sentences.english: 'I haven't offended you often by love-making?
sentences.chinese: 我向你求爱，并没有常常故意惹你生气啊？

sentences.english: Fathers do not embitter your children, or they will become discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 你们做父亲的，不要惹儿女的气，恐怕他们失了志气。

sentences.english: Nine bead application of my vexatious rights to provoke nan peja trouble.
sentences.chinese: 九珠应用本人的无理取闹权益惹楠佩费事。

sentences.english: Don't make him angry than you can help.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要把他惹得发了脾气。

sentences.english: We must forgive those about whom we are embittered.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须原谅那些惹我们生气的人。

sentences.english: Fireflies fly everywhere on summer nights, which attract children to chase after them.
sentences.chinese: 夏日的夜晚，流萤飞舞，惹得孩子们争着抓扑。

sentences.english: I remember you were upset by the ants.
sentences.chinese: 我犹有记忆你被红蚁惹毛的样子。

sentences.english: His temper's been changeable this week, so don't annoy him.
sentences.chinese: 这礼拜他脾气变幻无常，所以不要惹他负气。

definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to flip out/to act out violently
to stir up the fire/fig. to provoke and offend people/to ruffle feathers
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
